task_summary: Pick up the teapot and place it onto the stove using a robot arm, ensuring reliable detection, grasp, and safe placement.

task_long_description.overview: This episode demonstrates an autonomous robot arm performing a precise pick-and-place operation in a kitchen setting. The goal is to locate the teapot, grasp it using a top-down strategy, and place it stably onto the stove area. The task includes robust perception, careful grasp validation, and gentle object placement to avoid spills or misalignment. Reliable execution depends on continuous object visibility, careful approach, and appropriate force control when grasping and placing the teapot.
preconditions: The teapot is in the workspace, initially off the stove.
The stove surface is clear and accessible.
The gripper is open and ready.
stepwise_plan: Verify the teapot is visible or scan to find it.
Localize the teapot and approach from above.
Open the gripper and compute a valid top grasp pose.
Approach, lower until contact, and close gripper to grasp.
Check stove visibility; detect if needed.
Place the teapot on the stove with gentle force.
success_criteria: Teapot is stably placed on the stove surface.
No collisions with scene or loss of object.
Robot gripper releases object after placement.
failure_and_recovery: If teapot not detected: retry scanning up to three times.
If grasp fails: verify stability and possibly retry action.
If stove not detected: retry detection before placement.
On unexpected collision or loss: abort and report.
task_long_description.termination: Episode ends when the teapot is placed and gripper is retreated from the stove.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Place the teapot on the stove

node_specs.description: Checks if the teapot is visible to sensors.
Scans workspace to locate the teapot if not initially visible.
Performs focused detection to localize the teapot in 3D.
Opens the gripper to prepare for object grasping.
Moves the end-effector above the teapot to a safe pre-grasp pose.
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the teapot.
Aligns with the teapot to meet the grasp pose constraints.
Lowers the end-effector until gentle contact with the teapot.
Closes gripper to grasp the teapot.
Checks if the stove is visible to sensors.
Detects the stove for accurate placement.
Moves above the stove preparing for placement.
Places teapot onto the stove, pressing gently.
Opens gripper to release the teapot.
Waits briefly to finalize placement and ensure stability.

failure_modes: Teapot not detected after 3 scan attempts
Placement obstructed or press force exceeded
recovery_strategy: Abort if grasp remains unstable; report
Abort if repeated collision or lost object
assumptions: All objects visible in frames are exactly the task targets (teapot and stove).
The pose and scale of objects in the simulation correspond to allowed parameters.
The 'place' action is modeled as 'PlaceOnSurface' (mapping from 'on the stove'), as no more precise area is visible.
No conflicting cues between frames and instruction detected.
The teapot is fully disengaged from the gripper at the end of the episode.

expected_success_criteria: No tipping, slippage, or loss detected after gripper release.
